Key Match Events: Hungary threatened the Bosnian goal a handful of times in both halves; while the opposition did not even get a shot on goal until the 66th minute of the game.
Bosnian goalkeeper Nikola Vasilj made a series of impressive saves to keep the match goalless.
Hungary captain Dominik Szoboszlai came the closest to beating Vasilj, but his free kick ended up hitting the crossbar.
Martin Ádám had the last opportunity to clutch the winner for his country, but his header from a clear chance was yet again denied by Bosnia’s number one.
Pre-Game Insights: Head coach Marco Rossi made a handful of changes in the starting eleven compared to the last, unfortunate game in Düsseldorf.
Hungary were clearly the more active side all throughout the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Marco Rossi has had some rough periods on the Hungary bench already, and always managed to climb back, eventually leading his team to their third consecutive European Championship this summer.
The fans in the stands were not particularly impressed with this performance either.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The fans jeered and whistled after the referee blew the game.
The Hungarian football national team tied Bosnia and Herzegovina 0–0 in the UEFA Nations League.
Others: Hungary captain Dominik Szoboszlai told the Hungarian sports daily Nemzeti Sport that ‘it was like there were three people in the Bosnian goal’.
